subsection_content:
Depression is diagnosed based on clinical manifestations and a number of paraclinical tests to determine the disease and assess the level of depression, from which the doctor will have an appropriate treatment regimen.
1. Clinical diagnosis
Use depression diagnosis criteria according to ICD-10 or Depression diagnosis criteria according to DSM V standards.
2. Paraclinical testing
Doctors use tests to measure levels of neurotransmitters, determine the cause of depression, and rule out other possibilities. Some tests indicated for patients with depression include:
Psychological test; Clinical chat
3. Differential diagnosis
Depression is easily confused with other diseases, especially mental diseases. Therefore, the doctor will also have experience and expertise to properly determine the patient's situation.
